summary: AppShell header was updated to render a centered, desktop-only navigation set (including “Chat” and “Events”) gated by an authenticated+onboarded check, with active-route styling. The change also appears to introduce additional header links (e.g., My Profile/Admin) and may inadvertently hide public navigation items for unauthenticated/unonboarded users on desktop due to the top-level gating of the nav.

missing_requirements.requirement: On mobile (sm and below), users can still navigate via the existing bottom navigation behavior.
missing_requirements.reason: The diff is truncated before showing the mobile/bottom navigation portion of AppShell, so it cannot be verified from the provided evidence that the existing bottom navigation remains present/unchanged on small screens.

hallucinated_features.description: Added additional header navigation items beyond the requested “Events” and “Chat” (e.g., Community, Points, Partners).
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest only requires adding header links that include at least “Events” (/events) and “Chat” (/chat); adding multiple other primary header links is not explicitly requested.

hallucinated_features.description: Added a “My Profile” link in the header for onboarded/authenticated users.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested by REQ-24/REQ-25 (scope is header links to Events and Chat for discoverability).

hallucinated_features.description: Potential regression: hides all desktop header navigation (including items marked public like “Home” and “Partners”) unless the user is authenticated and onboarded.
hallucinated_features.reason: The entire desktop nav block is wrapped in `{canAccessCommunity && (...)}`, which prevents rendering any header nav items for unauthenticated/unonboarded users, even though `navItems` includes `public: true` entries.

hallucinated_features.description: Added an Admin link/section in the header.
